an3.5:1.1: “A fool is known by three things.
an3.5:1.3: They ask a question improperly. They answer a question improperly. And when someone else answers a question properly—with well-rounded, coherent, and relevant words and phrases—they disagree with it.
an3.5:1.4: These are the three things by which a fool is known.
an3.5:2.1: An astute person is known by three things.
an3.5:2.3: They ask a question properly. They answer a question properly. And when someone else answers a question properly—with well-rounded, coherent, and relevant words and phrases—they agree with it.
an3.5:2.4: These are the three things by which an astute person is known.
